data.title: Central government debt management – Frontpage
data.meta_description: The State Treasury is responsible for Finland’s central government borrowing as well as debt and liquidity management. Find the latest information here.
data.text:
Auctions

The State Treasury issues Treasury bills and serial bonds in auctions. Here you can find details of our upcoming auctions.

Credit ratings

The government has credit ratings from two credit rating agencies: Fitch Ratings and S&P Global Ratings. For long-term debt, they are AA+ and AA+, respectively.

Statistics

At the end of June 2024, the central government debt was EUR 165.97 billion. This means EUR 29 464 per capita.

Quarterly Review Q2/2024

State Treasury is planning to issue a new euro benchmark bond in Q3, likely in August-September.

Investor Relations

In this section: an investor presentation and latest economic forecast.

Finland and ESG

In this section: indicators, rankings and analyses – as well as information on Finnish government’s key sustainability targets.

Facts about central government debt

What is meant by central government borrowing? Who are Finland's creditors? Answers to frequently asked questions.

Debt Management Annual Review 2023

Summary of the funding, liquidity, and risk management operations of Finland’s central government.
